metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7439 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The C software implementation of RSA in wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before3.9.10 makes it easier for local users to discover RSA keys by leveragingcache-bank hit differences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl19 - 3.9.10+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.10+dfsg-1').
